# Mass Distribution

| Object | Solar System Mass %|
|--------|---------------------------------|
| Sun    | **99.80%** |
| Jupiter | 0.10% |
| All other planets | 0.04% |
| Comets | 0.0005%-0.03% |
| Moons and Rings | 0.0005% |
| Asteroids | 0.000002% |
| Cosmic Dust | 0.0000001 |

# Density Calculation

::: {.callout-note icon=false}
## Density of Saturn
$$\text{Density}=\frac{\text{Mass}}{\text{Volume}} \qquad \rho=\frac{M}{V}$$
$$V=\frac{4}{3}\pi r^3 $$
$$\rho=\frac{5.683\times10^{26}\text{kg}}{\tfrac{4}{3}\pi(58.232\times10^6\text{m})^3}=687.07\text{kg/m}^3$$
:::

# Interiors of the Giant Planets


:::: {.columns}

::: {.column width="45%"}
![[Numbers are thousands of kilometers](https://openstax.org/books/astronomy-2e/pages/11-2-the-giant-planets#OSC_Astro_11_02_Internal)](figures/07/Gas-Giant-Interiors.svg){#fig-gas-interior fig-align="center" height=500} 
:::
::: {.column width="50%"}

- At depths of a few 1,000 km, gases are compressed so much they liquefy.
- At higher pressure and temperature, liquid hydrogen acts like a metal, metallic hydrogen.
- Cores are a liquid mixture of water, rock, and metals.
:::

# Transit Method {.smaller}

{{< video figures/07/transit_method_single_planet.mp4 width="800" height="400" >}}
![[Measure amount light is dimmed during a planet's transit.](https://exoplanets.nasa.gov/alien-worlds/ways-to-find-a-planet/#/2) ](){#fig-exo-transit fig-align="left"} 

$$ \text{Percent Reduction in light} = \frac{\text{Cross sectional area of planet}}{\text{Cross sectional area of star}}
    = \frac{\pi r^2}{\pi R^2}
$$

# Radial Velocity

{{< video figures/07/radial_velocity.mp4 width="800" height="400" >}}
![[Motion of star detected as Doppler shifts on Earth.](https://exoplanets.nasa.gov/alien-worlds/ways-to-find-a-planet/#/1) ](){#fig-exo-radial-velocity fig-align="left"} 

- Stars with **periodic** velocity changes are orbited by planets.
- Stars and planets orbit their center of mass.
